Description: Steatite jewellery or figure-mould and its modern impressions; one side of the mould could be used for casting a bearded god wearing a high hat and a goddess with elaborate necklace holding her breasts; the other side could be used for casting three amulets with suspension loops; a disc with a cross and globes (probably a sun symbol), a crescent moon and a figure with hands clasped; complete.
Bibliographic references: Leichty E et al 1988a / Catalogue of the Babylonian Tablets in the British Museum, volume VIII: Tablets from Sippar 3 (p.299)
Acquisition name: From: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
